field.name: summary
field.value: Generic Typed Factories no longer working in trunk

field.name: description
field.value:
In the latest trunk build (2180), a generic typed factory does not work as expected.
Calling the creational method on the generic typed factory instance resolved from the container returns the following error:
System.Exception : Can't find information about factory method IFoo GetFoo(System.String). This is most likely a bug. Please report it.
This issue does not exist in 2.5.2. Also, non-generic typed factories are not affected. I have attached a unit test file with a failing test that reproduces the problem.
Thanks!

comment.author: slange
comment.text: As an aside, I upgraded to trunk to validate that IOC-250 and IOC-253 were fixed. I would like to integrate the fix to IOC-250 into my production environment ASAP, so I was wondering if you are planning to do an official release sometime soon that includes it. Alternatively, I would be willing to go to production with a trunk build if you believe the current trunk to be stable. Thanks!

comment.author: xtoff
comment.text: The trunk is not stable. I will port back those fixes that I can and make that 2.5.3 Cheers.

comment.author: slange
comment.text: Thanks very much -- I appreciate it.

comment.author: slange
comment.text: I grabbed build 27 from the 2.5 release branch. It looks like there are some problems with the build configurations. The .NET 3.5 distribution includes a .NET 3.5 version of Castle.Core and a .NET 4.0 version of Castle.Windsor. The .NET 4.0 distribution includes the .NET 4.0 Castle.Windsor and the .NET 4.0 Client Profile version of Castle.Core. Sorry to post this here, I wasn't sure if there's a better mechanism of contacting you guys regarding issues like this.

comment.author: xtoff
comment.text: ok, thanks for catching this. I'll have a look.

comment.author: roelofb
comment.text:
The build configurations on TeamCity have been fixed. Thanks for catching this, Stuart.
Please note that Castle.Core is always .NET 4.0 Client Profile, there's no version (needed) for the full 4.0 fx

comment.author: slange
comment.text: Thanks for fixing the build configs. I can confirm that the .NET 3.5 package from build #28 from the 2.5.x release branch is valid. However, it appears that the fix to IOC-250 that Krzysztof backported is not quite complete. I have a unit test that illustrates the problem, so I opened up IOC-266 to track. Thanks very much.
